title: Calories in a Vape
meta_description: Discover calories in a vape: typically zero since vapes aren't food, but explore e-liquid components, nutrition basics, and health notes.
assumptions: Standard disposable vape device with nicotine e-liquid (propylene glycol, vegetable glycerin, flavorings); not ingested as food.
disclaimer: Vapes are not edible; 'calories' refer to potential energy in e-liquid if somehow metabolized, but values are negligible. Consult health experts for vaping risks.

quick_answer.text: A standard vape has 0 calories, as it's inhaled vapor, not consumed food.

label_note: Values reflect non-food nature; no standard Nutrition Facts apply.

tweaks.label: Sweetened e-liquid flavor (e.g., with added sugars)

faqs.a: Generally 0 calories, as e-liquids aren't metabolized like food; trace amounts possible in sweetened variants.

faqs.q: What about calories in vape juice?
faqs.a: E-liquid may have negligible calories from sweeteners or glycerin, but typically under 5 kcal per ml if any.

faqs.q: Is vaping a way to consume calories?
faqs.a: No, inhaled vapor doesn't provide nutritional calories; it's not digestion.

faqs.q: How does e-liquid composition affect nutrition?
faqs.a: Propylene glycol and VG are carbs but not absorbed as energy via lungs; flavors may add minimal sugars.

faqs.q: Are there health risks beyond calories in vaping?
faqs.a: Yes, vaping poses risks like nicotine addiction and lung irritation; calories are irrelevant compared to these.
